page.title: 15Post & Telecommunications
page.content: Since this is a low population area there is only one Post Office at Wistow and none in the Raveleys. There are, however, daily mail deliveries throughout the area. The main avenue of communication is the telephone. All the farms and principal services in the area are available on the telephone, and all lines are based on the Ramsey exchange. Additionally a telephone call box is available for public use in all three villages. There are various forms of radio communication also. There is an amateur radio transmitter and receiver living in Wistow and a small number of people in Wistow and the Raveleys operate C.B. (Citizen Band) radios. Another form of communication especially popular on the larger farms is personal radio systems.
